content.description: Traverse along the bottom section along the crack. Fun compression moves. Generally small crimps. A few foot holds, so you'll be smearing a lot. Up the slab section to the right. Avoid using the big foot hold under the slab section, which makes the climb more challenging.
content.protection: Crash pad recommended. There is a big rock in front of the climb, which is perfect for sitting, but dangerous for falling. A spotter or two is recommended.

content.description:
There's a relatively small boulder at this location. It's location is pretty far out, so I wouldn't recommend making the drive for this one specific area. However, if you are in the area anyways, it's a cool spot to hit up. Also, it's about a 10-15 minute drive from the Trout Brook Nature Reserve, which is great for hiking. So, if you go hiking there, and want a little climbing afterwards, this is a great spot to do so.

 Also, something worth noting is that I found some old barbed wire scattered throughout the area. It's sparse, but could be easy to miss. I would not consider it dangerous, since it's old and dull by this point, but it's still worth noting.Â
